alert.note: Alert for Dougherty; Lee; Terrell; Turner; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 7:03PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Dougherty, southwestern Turner, Lee, Terrell and northern Worth Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 702 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Shellman to near Albany to 6 miles northeast of Marine Corps Logistics Base to near Ashburn. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dawson, Leesburg, Albany, Ashburn, Smithville, East Albany, Turner City, Marine Corps Logistics Base, Worth, Terrell, Sasser, Bronwood, Parrott, Stocks, Forrester, Palmyra, Red Rock, Dawson Municipal A/P, Acree and Hobby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
